results.title: Clearing the way
results.brief_description: A certain vacant allotment in Manhattan, New York, was regarded by a group of children as their own particular stamping-ground. Came the day when the building of the United Nations Organisation headquarters began on that allotment. The children, deprived of their playground, set out to find just what sort of an organisation United Nations Organisation was, and what sort of work it does.

results.title: Clear, clean water
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Outlines a new process for water purification called Sirofloc, developed by the CSIRO, and explains it in the context of Australia’s limited water resources. Looks at the first commercial plant in Perth.

results.title: Clear and present danger
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Mace Neufeld, Robert Rehme and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: Tom Clancy created the hero Jack Ryan in a series of thriller espionage novels. Harrison Ford again plays the intrepid CIA agent. When his mentor (James Earl Jones) becomes gravely ill, Ryan is appointed CIA Deputy Director of Intelligence. A tough first assignment awaits when he is asked to investigate the murder of a personal friend of the President with secret ties to Columbian drug cartels. A deadly field operative (Willem Dafoe) has been despatched in a covert operation against the Columbians unbeknown to Ryan. Directed by Australia’s Philip Noyce, this is an action-packed film which looks at corruption in the corridors of power.

results.title: Clear across Australia
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advances being made in telecommunications in Australia. A microwave radio repeater system now joins the systems of Eastern and Western Australia. Shows the phases of construction and the benefits of this system which is vital to our communications network.

results.title: Cleanliness and health
results.brief_description: Micro-photography is used to show the existence of micro-organisms and how these may be controlled. The film explains how these organisms are responsible for disease and how to avoid such diseases. Careful attention must be paid to the rules of cleanliness.

results.title: Clean waters
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatic presentation of the function of water in everyday life. Fish, game, livestock and human beings must have clean water - polluted water brings death. Public health is endangered, recreational facilities are limited, the productivity of streams and lakes decreased and property values fall disastrously when water is polluted or there is danger of pollution. “Clean Waters” gives a very interesting account of two American sewage treatment methods which prevent pollution of water. See also “Clean waters” (002150) - same message, different images.

results.title: Clean waters
results.creator_credit: Raphael G. Wolff Studios and Raphael Wolff
results.brief_description: This film is a variation of another film of the same title (307748). It contains the same message, but different images, of the function of water in everyday life. Fish, game, livestock, and human beings must have clean water - polluted water brings death. Public health is endangered, recreational facilities are limited, the productivity of streams and lakes decreased, and property values fall disastrously when water is polluted or there is danger of pollution. “Clean Waters” gives a very interesting account of two American sewage treatment methods which prevent pollution of water.
